The lib.rs and main.rs files now have ~25 #![allow(clippy::...)] directives added during bd-2yu to quickly reduce warnings. Over time, address these properly:

**High-value targets (fix the code):**
- too_many_arguments → refactor to parameter structs
- too_many_lines → split large functions
- must_use_candidate → add #[must_use] to appropriate functions

**Medium-value (improve docs):**
- doc_markdown → add backticks to doc comments
- missing_errors_doc → add # Errors sections
- missing_panics_doc → add # Panics sections

**Low-value (keep allowing):**
- cast_* variants → intentional in TUI code
- uninlined_format_args → style preference
- similar_names → context makes them clear

Approach: Pick one allow at a time, remove it, fix the warnings, commit. Don't try to do all at once.

title: total code review
description:
problem: I'm having difficulty instructing the model on how to style the TUI without breaking other parts of the TUI.

- do an architecture review of the entire project
- comment on this bead how the project is structured

I'm suspecting we need some kind of component system for consistently syling components. Maybe we have this.

comments.author: Bob
comments.text:
## Architecture Review: botcrit-ui

### Project Structure (21 source files)

```
src/
  main.rs          (1233 lines) - Event loop, input mapping, data loading, demo mode
  model.rs         (413 lines)  - Flat Model struct (~40 fields), Screen/Focus/LayoutMode enums
  message.rs                    - Message enum with ~42 variants
  update.rs        (876 lines)  - Single match on Message, state transitions
  stream.rs        (532 lines)  - Stream layout computation (scroll math, line counting)
  command.rs                    - Command palette command definitions
  config.rs                     - User config (theme, default_diff_view)
  db.rs            (288 lines)  - SQLite access layer
  syntax.rs        (341 lines)  - Syntax highlighting via syntect
  text.rs                       - Text wrapping utilities
  vcs.rs           (208 lines)  - Git/jj VCS integration
  diff/
    mod.rs, parse.rs            - Unified diff parser
  theme/
    mod.rs         (523 lines)  - Theme system (seeds, overrides, loading, 10 built-in themes)
  view/
    mod.rs                      - Screen router (dispatches to list or detail)
    components.rs  (185 lines)  - Shared primitives (Rect, draw_box, fill_rect, draw_text_truncated, draw_badge)
    diff.rs        (2921 lines) - Diff rendering (unified, side-by-side, comments, context, stream)
    review_list.rs (279 lines)  - Review list screen
    review_detail.rs (479 lines)- Review detail screen (sidebar + diff pane)
    command_palette.rs (337 lines)- Command/theme picker modal
```

### Elm Architecture Flow

**Model** (model.rs): Single flat struct with ~40 fields covering screen state, data, UI state, command palette, commenting, layout, theme, and a `RefCell<HashMap>` for thread positions written during view.

**Messages** (message.rs): ~42 variants covering navigation, scrolling, file selection, thread management, focus, diff view toggling, command palette, commenting, theme, and system events.

**Update** (update.rs): Single `fn update(&mut Model, Message)` with a large match. Directly mutates model. Some recursive dispatch (CommandPaletteExecute -> HideCommandPalette + action). Helpers for file navigation, scroll clamping, and thread centering.

**View** (view/mod.rs): Dispatches to `review_list::view` or `review_detail::view` based on `model.screen`, then overlays command palette. Views call `buffer.draw_text()` and `buffer.fill_rect()` imperatively.

**Event Loop** (main.rs): render -> check quit -> load data -> poll input -> map to message -> update. Input mapping functions serve as a "controller" layer. Data loading (DB queries, VCS diffs) happens as side effects in the loop.

### Styling System

The `Theme` struct is the central styling authority with:
- 7 base/UI colors (background, foreground, border, border_focused, panel_bg, selection_bg/fg, cursor)
- 5 semantic colors (primary, success, warning, error, muted)
- `DiffTheme` sub-struct (12 colors for diff rendering)
- `SyntaxColors` sub-struct (11 colors for syntax highlighting)

Themes are constructed from 7 "seed" colors with all others derived via lerp/blend. Optional overrides can fine-tune any derived color. 10 built-in themes are embedded at compile time.

**How styles are applied**: Every view function accesses `model.theme` directly and constructs `Style` values inline at each draw call site. There are no pre-built "style tokens" or "style constants" -- each `buffer.draw_text()` call builds its own `Style::fg(theme.foreground).with_bg(theme.background)`.

### Component System

**There is no formal component system.** The closest things are:
- `view/components.rs`: Shared primitives (Rect, draw_box, fill_rect, etc.)
- `StreamCursor` in diff.rs: Virtual scroll abstraction tracking stream_row vs screen_row
- Various private helper functions within each view file

No component trait, no declarative composition, no isolated/testable components. Each view is a collection of imperative draw calls.

### Key Architectural Issues

1. **diff.rs is 2921 lines** -- contains unified diff, side-by-side, comments, context, thread range bars, file headers, pinned headers, highlight text, text wrapping, stream orchestration, AND legacy standalone renderers

2. **Duplicated layout constants** -- DIFF_H_PAD, DIFF_MARGIN, ORPHANED_CONTEXT_LEFT_PAD are defined independently in diff.rs, stream.rs, and update.rs with only comments ("Must match DIFF_MARGIN in diff.rs") maintaining sync

3. **Stream layout must mirror rendering** -- stream.rs computes line counts that diff.rs must emit exactly, but they are separate implementations. If rendering emits different row counts than layout predicts, scrolling breaks silently

4. **Duplicated help bars** -- review_list.rs and review_detail.rs each have their own draw_help_bar with different data structures but identical algorithms

5. **Duplicated dim_rect** -- review_detail.rs::dim_rect and command_palette.rs::dim_background are nearly identical

6. **RefCell thread_positions** -- view writes thread screen positions into a RefCell that update reads for navigation. Breaks the pure Elm contract, creates temporal coupling

7. **Legacy renderers** -- render_diff_with_threads, render_diff_side_by_side, render_file_context exist alongside render_diff_stream, adding confusion

8. **main.rs mixes concerns** -- input mapping, data loading, demo data, argument parsing, editor launching all in 1233 lines

comments.author: Bob
comments.text:
Root cause found and fixed. Two bugs:

1. SBS anchor/comment maps matched old-side line numbers (view/diff.rs:966-983). The sbs_anchor_map and sbs_comment_map checked both sl.left and sl.right for matching thread line numbers. When an old-side line number coincidentally equaled a thread's selection_start/end (e.g., old line 725 = th-vy29's selection_start 725), the thread comment rendered at both the new-side anchor AND the old-side match. Fix: only match on sl.right (new side), consistent with map_threads_to_diff.

2. Orphaned context exclusion ranges only covered new-side hunk lines (view/diff.rs, stream.rs). The hunk_ranges used to clip orphaned context were built from (new_start, new_start+new_count-1) only. When an orphaned thread's context window overlapped with old-side diff lines (e.g., th-1suy context 708-741 vs old-side 710-716 in hunk 2), those lines appeared in both orphaned context and the diff. Fix: new hunk_exclusion_ranges() helper in diff/parse.rs computes union of old+new side ranges, merged.

Repro: cr-klwd, src/server/mod.rs, SBS mode. th-vy29 (selection_start=725) appeared twice - once at new line 725, once after old line 725. th-1suy orphaned context showed old lines 710-716 that also appeared in the diff hunk.
